Pre-Game Insights: Australia have had a sequence of eight victories, while India has dominated the tournament with a high average winning margin and strong performances.
Australia's fast-bowling World-Cup-winning captain Pat Cummins has had a decent tournament, with memorable contributions mostly from the bat.
India's pace attack, led by Mohammed Shami, has been exceptional, capable of performing well on any type of pitch.
Australia may consider bringing Marcus Stoinis into the team ahead of Marnus Labuschagne against India's quality attack.
Six of the likely players across the two teams have played in a World Cup final before and won their first final.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The final feels like the culmination of all the events since October 5, with both teams being considered the best of the competition.
India has been like the sun, and Australia like Jupiter, in terms of their dominance and ability to handle pressure.
Others: Pat Cummins aims to join the Australian pantheon of World-Cup-winning captains, and there is a more exclusive list of fast-bowling World-Cup-winning captains.
There may be some dew to contend with due to the early winter nip in the air in the evenings, potentially affecting the ball's condition.
